intro: Stenanona costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican stenanona, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
